description: Core fundamental tools required across all build processes

node.description: Node.js runtime for build scripts and CI workflows
node.notes: recommendedVersion is the version we build/test against. All CI workflows use this version.

pnpm.description: Fast, disk space efficient package manager
pnpm.notes: Version is managed via packageManager field in package.json. This is the minimum compatible version.

python.description: Python interpreter for build scripts and model tooling
python.notes: recommendedVersion is used for CI workflows. apt version is Ubuntu 22.04 default.

git.description: Git version control system (fundamental for source cloning)
git.notes: Usually pre-installed on most systems. Required for git clone operations.

curl.description: Command-line tool for transferring data (fundamental for downloads)
curl.notes: Usually pre-installed. Required for downloading archives and files.

patch.description: GNU patch utility for applying diffs (fundamental for patching)
patch.notes: Required for applying patch files to source code.

make.description: GNU Make build tool (fundamental build orchestration)
make.notes: Standard build tool. Usually pre-installed on Unix systems.

ninja.description: Ninja build system (faster than Make for C++ projects)
ninja.notes: Much faster than Make for large C++ projects. Recommended for ONNX Runtime and Yoga Layout builds.

ccache.notes: Significantly speeds up recompilation by caching previous compilations.

bc.notes: Pre-installed on macOS. Used for floating-point arithmetic in build scripts.

notes: This file contains ONLY core fundamental tools. All package-specific and checkpoint-specific tools are declared in their respective external-tools.json files.
